Dear MCA Students,

Pop Quiz: When SHOULD someone ask for help?

When things get a little worse? When they just can't take it anymore? When the suffering has gone on long enough?

Cheat Sheet:
NOW is always the right time to ask for the help you need. Not after things get a little worse, not when you're barely hanging on, not when you've suffered long enough. This is true for both physical and emotional needs.

Our staff is standing by waiting for you to ask us for what you need. If you're feeling anxious, depressed, experiencing abuse or suffering from any other physical or emotional stress, YOU are in need of help now. Please do not suffer needlessly. Suffering does not make you strong and brave. Asking for what you need, makes you strong and brave.

We can and will help you.

Please text/call:
Mr. Zach: (231) 330-6880
Ms. Shelly: (231) 733-6869

Or message any other staff member you feel comfortable with.

Always Here,
Your MCA Family

In honor of Martin Luther King Jr., MCA will be observing this day as a holiday and therefore the school will be closed.

At the age of thirty-five, Martin Luther King, Jr., was the youngest man to have received the Nobel Peace Prize. When notified of his selection, he announced that he would turn over the prize money of $54,123 to the furtherance of the civil rights movement.

On the evening of April 4, 1968, while standing on the balcony of his motel room in Memphis, Tennessee, where he was to lead a protest march in sympathy with striking garbage workers of that city, he was assassinated.

Learn more about Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. here: https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1964/king/biographical/
